content.description: This route starts up a chimney then angles left under an overhang for 15 feet. A little thrutchy for a move or two then fun with a really cool move to turn the end of the roof. From here it climbs over moderate rock to a short hanging corner. More moderate cruising leads to a deceptively stout finish sequence to jugs above the anchors. The rock is a little less than perfect at the bottom but a lot of bolts make it less nerve racking. This will eventually clean up and be even less of an issue.
content.protection: 12 draws needed and not those silly six inch things, 8 inches or longer, length does matter on this climb. There are also four chain draws under the roof to make it easy to clean. without these a person would have to follow it or a serious battle would ensue to clean the draws.

content.description: Climbs a crack/corner, then a featured steep face and arete on the west face. You will pass under this route when approaching the Train Station. Continuous and exciting climbing, particularly on the exposed upper arete. Mostly good rock, with a short section of poorer rock in the middle, but the quality and exposure make this a pretty good route.
content.protection: 12 bolts,  lower off anchors. Belay bolt at start of route.
content.location: Starts on a platform above and right of Chattanooga Choo Choo on the west face of Choo Choo Rock. You will pass below this route on the approach to the Train Station. Starts at a belay bolt, then moves up and right through a crack system, face and upper arete.

climbs.name: Coati Sleeper Car
climbs.fa: Galen Dara Smith, Karen Wilson, Don Wilson, September 2020

content.description: This route climbs the buttress right of Fright Train. Start at the toe of the buttress, then up and right into a nice hand crack, turn a small roof, and continue up the clean face, gradually moving left to the top of the buttress. Good rock, fun climbing.
content.location: 20 feet right of Fright Train, starting at the toe of the buttress right of Fright Train.

content.description: At the far right end of Choo Choo Rock. Starts up a face below a right facing corner/roof. Pass two initial bolts, then up a crack and another bolt, then about 4 more bolts on the arete/face above.
content.protection: Approx 7 bolts. Some gear could be used down low between the 2nd and 3rd bolt. Anchors. The anchor for Amtrak Crack is found a few feet right and around the corner from this anchor.
content.location: Right side of Choo Choo Rock.

climbs.name: Amtrak Crack
climbs.fa: Don Wilson, Karen Wilson, Galen Dara Smith, September 2020

content.description: Climb the first 4 bolts of Fright Train, then cut left, following the obvious crack system on good featured rock, with good pro.  Good route for someone learning to place gear, as bolts protect the lower portion and solid gear gear with steep climbing is found above.
content.protection: There is one anchor bolt for the belayer. Then 4 bolts and a single set of cams up to #2. A few small (0.2-0.3) cams or nuts helpful. Anchor has fatty Climb Tech hooks. The anchor for Chattanooga Choo Choo is found just left and around the corner from this anchor.
content.location: Start on the platform up and right of Chatanooga Choo Choo.  Same start as Fright Train
